NO DEAL Liverpool facing possible transfer ban for tapping up 12-year-old Stoke starlet with promise of private school fees 
The Premier League side is being investigated over a failed deal to lure the talented teenager to Anfield By Wally Downes Jr Comments LIVERPOOL could be hit by a transfer ban after tapping up a 12-year-old Stoke City starlet. 
And the Telegraph have revealed the Anfield club even fell out with the player and his family after backing out on a promise to pay his private school fees. PA:Press Association 4 Jurgen Klopp wants Liverpool to be able to sign the world’s best young talent 
The once-promising teenager is now left in limbo as he cannot join a new club until Liverpool cough up £49,000 to the Potteries side in compensation. 
Keep up to date with all the latest news, gossip, rumours and done deals in SunSport’s live transfer blog 
If the club is found guilty of the dodgy deal from last summer there are a range of punishments that could be dished out, with an ineffective fine most likely. 
But there is also an option to enforce a registration ban on the club signing youth players which would hit Jurgen Klopp’s efforts to sign Europe’ best young players. 
Premier League rivals, especially in the north of England like Manchester United and City, would be able to secure future stars while Liverpool are blocked. Liverpool are not the only club to be under investigation after a rules shake-up at the start of the season in an attempt to end the unsettling trend for young-player poaching. 
Champions Leagues sides Real Madrid, Barcelona and Atletico Madrid have all been hit with similar bans for seducing the parents of prodigious young players. The Premier League is taking drastic steps to stop players as young as ten being moved all over the country with payments and incentives offered to parents. 
A new five-step process for analysing academy switches has been introduced with the Premier League able to demand the phone records of all involved if they get suspicious.
